category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 12 (Designation of Management Organization)
contents: Article 12 (Designation of Management Organization) ① When the Sports Association determines that it is difficult for a member organization to operate normally due to any of the following reasons, it may designate a member organization as a management organization through a resolution of the Board of Directors. When the Sports Association wishes to designate a member sports association as a management organization, it must inform and consult in advance with the international sports federation to which the organization belongs. When it wishes to designate a member city/provincial sports association as a management organization, it must obtain approval for the establishment of the organization in advance. This must be notified and discussed with the head of the local government. Revised 2017. 6. 8., 2021. 3. 16., 2021. 7. 5., 1. When the obligations under Article 10, Paragraph 2 and Paragraph 4 are significantly neglected. 2. Vacancies or accidents of the head of a member organization for more than 60 days. , 3. Various disputes related to the International Sports Organization, 4. Various disputes related to member organizations, 5. Inability to carry out normal business due to financial deterioration or other reasons, ② If the Sports Association wishes to designate a management organization, explanation must be given to the member organization or its representative. Opportunities must be granted., ③ Among management organizations, regular member organizations are included in the number of registered delegates when a general meeting is held, but are not included in the number of delegates present, and cannot exercise voting rights., ④ Designation of management organizations other than those stipulated in these Articles of Incorporation and Operation shall be determined separately.
